channel.title: Xen
channel.description:
The Xen parts are secret, so any suggestions can be null. But, about the Gonarch battle, i was thinking that it could be improved in some way.
Mainly the first part of the battle. I was thinking of an arena like the ones seen in Episode I and Episode two were the player fights the "Antlion Queen?"
I thought of a circular area filled with destructible rock pillars with a healing pool in the inner part of that said area. The area would resemble some type of alien ancient temple, with the healing pool surrounded by four undestructible alien "pillars", like the moving "towers" of Xen, only that these ones are smaller, a little bit taller than the destructible rock columns. I thought about four or five layers of circling rocks columns around the central healing pool.
The level starts with Gordon in an open place where he sees the Gonarch, the fight starts and he escapes looking for a good place to fight. As he retreats from Gonarch attacks, he reachs the forest of rocks that give him some temporary protection against the alien and allow for the killing of baby headcrabs. The Gonarch needs to hit the rock protections some times to be able to destroy each layer of rocks while Gordon can deal some damage to it.
Eventually, all rock protections are destroyed and there remains only the four circling pillars around the healing pool that would offer some protection until enough damage is done to start the next round of the fight.

item.title: Xen
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
I always thought that the floating surfaces in Xen looked like pieces of the ocean floor. Which would be gorgeous to model it after, in my opinion. But I hope the BM:S Dev team gets really creative and dark with Xen.

I would really like Xen to make me afraid and beset with wonder. I wanna see things like gigantic bacteria violently and silently ripping in half in the sky around you; lightning dancing across the chasms between the floating surfaces; small particles of worm-like bacteria constantly floating around like you’re underwater, yet floating; legions of the Manta Rays zipping obscurely past you down a vortex, etc.

Those are just random concepts of what you might expect to see in Xen – probably a much less complicated version of that, though.
Who knows, the devs could to anything with Xen and I would probably be happy.

The background of this would look cool – but maybe a little darker.
